For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"initialize(string,string,uint8)":{"details":"Sets the values for `name`, `symbol`, and `decimals`. All three of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during construction."},"initialize(string,string,uint8,uint256,uint256,address,address)":{"params":{"atm":"The ATMGovernance address for this token","cap":"The maximum number of tokens available","decimals":"The amount of decimals for token","maxVestingPerWallet":"The maximum number of times a wallet can mint their vesting","name":"The name of the token","settingsAddress":"The ATMSettings address","symbol":"The symbol of the token"}},"initialized()":{"return":"true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false."},"mint(address,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"The account to mint tokens for","amount":"The amount of tokens to mint"},"return":"true if successful"},"mintVesting(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"The account which tokens will be assigned to","amount":"The amount of tokens to be assigned","cliff":"The length of time (in seconds) after which the tokens will start vesting","vestingTime":"The length of the vesting period (in seconds)"}},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"revokeVesting(address,uint256)":{"params":{"account":"The account for which vesting is to be revoked","vestingId":"The Id of the vesting being revoked     "}},"setCap(uint256)":{"params":{"newCap":"The new capped amount of tokens"}},"settings()":{"details":"This address should NOT change over the time. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."}},"title":"TLR Token for the Teller Platform"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"balanceOfAt(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the balance of an account devdoc.author: develop@teller.finance

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params.account: The account which is being queried
params.snapshotId: The id of the snapshot being queried

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller.     * See {ERC20-_burn}.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

initialize(string,string,uint8).details: Sets the values for `name`, `symbol`, and `decimals`. All three of these values are immutable: they can only be set once during construction.

params.atm: The ATMGovernance address for this token
params.cap: The maximum number of tokens available
params.decimals: The amount of decimals for token
params.maxVestingPerWallet: The maximum number of times a wallet can mint their vesting
params.name: The name of the token

initialized().return: true if contract is initialized. Otherwise it returns false.

params.account: The account to mint tokens for
params.amount: The amount of tokens to mint

params.account: The account which tokens will be assigned to
params.amount: The amount of tokens to be assigned
params.cliff: The length of time (in seconds) after which the tokens will start vesting
params.vestingTime: The length of the vesting period (in seconds)

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

params.account: The account for which vesting is to be revoked
params.vestingId: The Id of the vesting being revoked

params.newCap: The new capped amount of tokens

settings().details: This address should NOT change over the time. See details in the _setSettings(...) function.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

params.snapshotId: The id of the snapshot being queried

params.amount: The amount to send Requirements:     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.
params.recipient: The address of the account receiving the tokens

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};     * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

devdoc.title: TLR Token for the Teller Platform

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).notice: Returns the balance of an account at the time a snapshot was created

cap().notice: Returns the cap on the token's total supply

initialized().notice: Gets if the contract is initialized.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Increase account supply of specified token amount

mintVesting(address,uint256,uint256,uint.notice: Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing the total supply.     * Includes a vesting period before address is allowed to use tokens     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.     * Requirements     * - `to` cannot be the zero address.

revokeVesting(address,uint256).notice: Revokes the amount vested to an account

setCap(uint256).notice: Sets a new cap on the token's total supply.

settings().notice: The gets the settings contract address from the SETTINGS_SLOT.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).notice: Returns the total supply at the time a snapshot was created

withdrawVested().notice: Withdrawal of tokens upon completion of vesting period
